security_audit.summary: This is a benign boilerplate template skill. All 25 static findings are false positives triggered by documentation references and metadata. The only code is a 23-line Python script that parses CLI arguments. No network access, no credential handling, no dangerous operations.

content.value_statement: Building skills from scratch requires boilerplate setup and structure decisions. This template provides a proven starting point with best practices for tool permissions, file organization, and error handling patterns.
actual_capabilities: Provides file structure template for new skills
Defines allowed tools in SKILL.md metadata
Documents error handling with EXIT_BLOCKED pattern
limitations: This is a template, not a functional skill
Requires customization for specific use cases
Does not perform any operations without modification

use_cases.title: Start new skill projects
use_cases.description: Copy this template to begin building a new DocEngineering skill with proper structure

use_cases.title: Enable Claude Code workflows
use_cases.description: Deploy to Claude Code for standardized skill execution with Read, Grep, and Write tools

use_cases.title: Maintain consistency
use_cases.description: Ensure all team skills follow the same organizational patterns and error handling

prompt_templates.title: New skill from template
prompt_templates.scenario: Create a new skill for a specific task
prompt_templates.prompt: Copy the skill-template to {newSkillPath} and customize SKILL.md with the skill name, description, and allowed tools for [your use case].

prompt_templates.title: Add tool permissions
prompt_templates.prompt: Update SKILL.md to add [specific tool] to allowed-tools. Ensure the tool is necessary and document why in the skill description.

prompt_templates.title: Implement entrypoint
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new script in scripts/ directory. The script should [describe function]. Update scripts/run.py to call this logic when appropriate.

prompt_templates.title: Add validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a validation function to scripts/run.py that checks [your requirements]. Return EXIT_BLOCKED if any check fails with a clear message.

output: Update SKILL.md with your skill name and description
Customize scripts/run.py for your use case
Run `calvin deploy` to deploy to platforms

output_examples.input: Add a new Python script for code formatting
Configure the skill for Claude Code platform
output: Ready for deployment to Claude Code

best_practices: Use relative paths via {baseDir} for portability across environments
Only request tool permissions that the skill actually needs
Ask for missing required inputs explicitly rather than failing silently
anti_patterns: Requesting excessive tool permissions beyond the skill requirements
Using hardcoded paths instead of {baseDir} placeholders
Returning partial results when critical validation fails

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This template supports Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Add platform-specific adapters for Antigravity, Cursor, or VSCode.

faq.question: What is the maximum file size for skill inputs?
faq.answer: File size limits depend on the target platform. For large inputs, process files in chunks using Read tool.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing workflows?
faq.answer: Update SKILL.md allowed-tools to include tools your skill needs. Use {baseDir} for paths relative to the skill root.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using skills?
faq.answer: Skills run in isolated environments. Review SKILL.md to understand what tools each skill can access.

faq.question: Why did my skill return EXIT_BLOCKED?
faq.answer: EXIT_BLOCKED indicates a hard gate failed. Check the returned message for specific blockers like missing inputs or validation failures.

faq.question: How does this compare to custom prompts?
faq.answer: Skills provide structure, error handling, and tool access control. Custom prompts offer flexibility but lack these safeguards.
